FuncDef:
The avoid-microloop frr-protected command enables IS-IS anti-microloop.
The undo avoid-microloop frr-protected command disables IS-IS anti-microloop.
By default, IS-IS anti-microloop is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If IS-IS remote FRR is enabled and the primary link fails, traffic is switched to the backup link. If route convergence occurs again, traffic is switched from the backup link to a new primary link. During the switchover, microloop may occur. To prevent this problem, IS-IS anti-microloop is enabled by the avoid-microloop frr-protected command.
Prerequisites
An IS-IS process has been created and the IS-IS view has been displayed using the isis command.
